title: Brokers pitch more than seven reasons to buy Elanor fund
text:
Yield, yield, yield.

That's all investors need to know about Elanor Commercial Property Fund, according to their brokers, as it goes about raising about $150 million for its initial public offering and ASX listing.

The Nexus Centre, a commercial centre in Brisbane that is part of the Elanor Commercial Property Fund.

The numbers on brokers' lips are the 7.2 per cent annualised distribution yield for the 2020 financial year, based on the 5.25¢ a share forecast distribution, increasing to 7.3 per cent in 2021.

There's also 8.3 per cent annual funds from operations yield in fiscal 2020, increasing to 8.4 per cent one year later.

The job for potential investors over the coming week or so is to ascertain how sustainable the advertised yield is likely to be. The fund has six properties and a 4.9-year weighted average lease expiry, according to a pathfinder prospectus blasted out to interested parties on Tuesday as revealed by Street Talk.
description: Yield, yield, yield. That's all investors need to know about Elanor Commercial Property Fund.
